title: IT ENDS WITH US
author: by Colleen Hoover
description: A battered wife raised in a violent home attempts to halt the cycle of abuse; the basis of the film.

title: APPRENTICE TO THE VILLAIN
author: by Hannah Nicole Maehrer
description: The second book in the Assistant and the Villain series. Evie Sage picks up some nefarious skills in order to protect her boss’s lair.

title: SHADOW OF DOUBT
author: by Brad Thor
description: The 23rd book in the Scot Harvath series. A mess of trouble involving double agents, international intrigue and a potential global firestorm forces Harvath to choose between his country and his conscience.

title: IT STARTS WITH US
author: by Colleen Hoover
description: In the sequel to “It Ends With Us,” Lily deals with her jealous ex-husband as she reconnects with her first boyfriend.

title: THE WOMEN
author: by Kristin Hannah
description: In 1965, a nursing student follows her brother to serve during the Vietnam War and returns to a divided America.

title: HILLBILLY ELEGY
author: by J.D. Vance
description: The Yale Law School graduate and 2024 Republican vice presidential nominee looks at the struggles of the white working class through the story of his own childhood.

title: THE ART OF POWER
author: by Nancy Pelosi
description: The representative from California chronicles her journey in politics, including her time as the first woman to serve as speaker of the House.

title: OVER RULED
author: by Neil Gorsuch and Janie Nitze
description: An associate justice of the United States Supreme Court questions the amount and complexity of laws in America.

title: THE ANXIOUS GENERATION
author: by Jonathan Haidt
description: A co-author of “The Coddling of the American Mind” looks at the mental health impacts that a phone-based life has on children.

title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
author: by Bessel van der Kolk
description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

title: THE WOMEN
author: by Kristin Hannah
description: In 1965, a nursing student follows her brother to serve during the Vietnam War and returns to a divided America.

title: THE COVEN
author: by Harper L. Woods
description: At Hollow’s Grove University, a school for magic that suffered a bloody massacre decades ago, 13 gifted students confront ghosts from the school’s past.

title: SHADOW OF DOUBT
author: by Brad Thor
description: The 23rd book in the Scot Harvath series. A mess of trouble involving double agents, international intrigue and a potential global firestorm forces Harvath to choose between his country and his conscience.

title: FOURTH WING
author: by Rebecca Yarros
description: Violet Sorrengail is urged by the commanding general, who also is her mother, to become a candidate for the elite dragon riders.

title: HARD TO KILL
author: by James Patterson and Mike Lupica
description: The second book in the Jane Smith series. A double triple homicide complicates matters for Smith.

title: THE ART OF POWER
author: by Nancy Pelosi
description: The representative from California chronicles her journey in politics, including her time as the first woman to serve as speaker of the House.

title: THE ANXIOUS GENERATION
author: by Jonathan Haidt
description: A co-author of “The Coddling of the American Mind” looks at the mental health impacts that a phone-based life has on children.

title: OVER RULED
author: by Neil Gorsuch and Janie Nitze
description: An associate justice of the United States Supreme Court questions the amount and complexity of laws in America.

title: ASK NOT
author: by Maureen Callahan
description: The author of “American Predator” puts forward a history of the Kennedy family that describes the abuse of women in its orbit.

title: THE DEMON OF UNREST
author: by Erik Larson
description: The author of “The Splendid and the Vile” portrays the months between the election of Abraham Lincoln and the beginning of the Civil War.

title: IT ENDS WITH US
author: by Colleen Hoover
description: A battered wife raised in a violent home attempts to halt the cycle of abuse; the basis of the film.

title: APPRENTICE TO THE VILLAIN
author: by Hannah Nicole Maehrer
description: The second book in the Assistant and the Villain series. Evie Sage picks up some nefarious skills in order to protect her boss’s lair.

title: IT STARTS WITH US
author: by Colleen Hoover
description: In the sequel to “It Ends With Us,” Lily deals with her jealous ex-husband as she reconnects with her first boyfriend.

title: THE HOUSEMAID
author: by Freida McFadden
description: Troubles surface when a woman looking to make a fresh start takes a job in the home of the Winchesters.

title: A COURT OF THORNS AND ROSES
author: by Sarah J. Maas
description: After killing a wolf in the woods, Feyre is taken from her home and placed inside the world of the Fae.

title: HILLBILLY ELEGY
author: by J.D. Vance
description: The Yale Law School graduate and 2024 Republican vice presidential nominee looks at the struggles of the white working class through the story of his own childhood.

title: THE BODY KEEPS THE SCORE
author: by Bessel van der Kolk
description: How trauma affects the body and mind, and innovative treatments for recovery.

title: THE BACKYARD BIRD CHRONICLES
author: by Amy Tan
description: Essays and drawings by the author of “The Joy Luck Club” and “The Bonesetter's Daughter,” which depict a search for peace through birding.

title: THE TRUTHS WE HOLD
author: by Kamala Harris
description: A memoir by the daughter of immigrants who is currently serving as the 49th vice president and is the Democratic Party's 2024 presidential nominee.

title: FRIENDS, LOVERS, AND THE BIG TERRIBLE THING
author: by Matthew Perry
description: The late actor, known for playing Chandler Bing on “Friends,” shares stories from his childhood and his struggles with sobriety.

title: THE CREATIVE ACT
author: by Rick Rubin with Neil Strauss

title: WONDER
author: by R.J. Palacio
description: A boy with a facial deformity starts school. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: REFUGEE
author: by Alan Gratz
description: Three children in three different conflicts look for safe haven. (Ages 9 to 12)

title: HEROES
author: by Alan Gratz
description: The friends Frank and Stanley give a vivid account of the Pearl Harbor attack. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: THE SUN AND THE STAR
author: by Rick Riordan and Mark Oshiro
description: The demigods Will and Nico embark on a dangerous journey to the Underworld to rescue an old friend. (Ages 10 to 14)

title: WINGS OF FIRE: A GUIDE TO THE DRAGON WORLD
author: by Tui T. Sutherland. Illustrated by Joy Ang
description: A deeper dive into the legends of the 10 dragon tribes. (Ages 8 to 12)

title: THE CRAYONS GO BACK TO SCHOOL
author: by Drew Daywalt. Illustrated by Oliver Jeffers
description: The crayons go back to school and can't wait for art class. (Ages 4 to 8)

title: DRAGONS LOVE TACOS
author: by Adam Rubin. Illustrated by Daniel Salmieri
description: What to serve your dragon-guests. (Ages 3 to 5)

title: THE WONDERFUL THINGS YOU WILL BE
author: by Emily Winfield Martin
description: A celebration of future possibilities. (Ages 3 to 7)

title: THE PIGEON HAS TO GO TO SCHOOL!
author: by Mo Willems
description: Pigeon deals with the anxieties of going to school for the first time. (Ages 3 to 5)

title: TIME FOR SCHOOL, LITTLE BLUE TRUCK
author: by Alice Schertle. Illustrated by Jill McElmurry
description: Blue gives a friend a ride to school. (Ages 4 to 7)

title: A GOOD GIRL'S GUIDE TO MURDER
author: by Holly Jackson
description: Pippa Fitz-Amobi solves murderous crimes. (Ages 14 and up)

title: THE POWERLESS TRILOGY
author: by Lauren Roberts
description: A story of forbidden love between Paedyn, an Ordinary, and Kai, an Elite, in the kingdom of Ilya. (Ages 14 and up)

title: THE WILD ROBOT
author: by Peter Brown
description: Roz the robot adapts to her surroundings on a remote, wild island. (Ages 7 to 12)

title: COVENANT
author: by Jennifer L. Armentrout
description: Alexandria and Aiden's forbidden love is challenged at every turn. (Ages 14 to 18)

title: HARRY POTTER
author: by J.K. Rowling
description: A wizard hones his conjuring skills in the service of fighting evil. (Ages 10 and up)

title: THE GRANDEST GAME
author: by Jennifer Lynn Barnes
description: A prize worth millions is up for grabs for seven players sequestered on a private island. (Ages 12 to 18)

title: THE REAPPEARANCE OF RACHEL PRICE
author: by Holly Jackson
description: Annabel Price's mother was presumed dead, until she reappears during the filming of a documentary about her disappearance. (Ages 14 to 17)

title: SUCH CHARMING LIARS
author: by Karen M. McManus
description: Two former stepsiblings unwillingly reunite and must solve a murder at a billionaire's birthday party. (Ages 14 to 17)

title: DEATH AT MORNING HOUSE
author: by Maureen Johnson
description: When Marlowe Wexler takes a job at Morning House, deadly mysteries unfold. (Ages 14 and up)

title: DIVINE RIVALS
author: by Rebecca Ross
description: Two young rival journalists find love through a magical connection. (Ages 13 to 18)
